results.title: Europe after the rain: Dada and Surrealism
results.creator_credit: Mick Gold and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: Examines Dada and Surrealism not simply as modern movements in the arts, but also as a history of ideas - emphasising the desire to unify political and psychological values with artistic creativity. Begins with the birth of Dada in Zurich, against the background of the first World War then continues to the Surrealist movement. Describes how Dada and Surrealism attempted to transform the world and how they were transformed by it. Credits: Scriptwriter, Mick Gold.

results.title: Europa nostra
results.creator_credit: Charles Mapleston, Peter Bradford and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: Shot in fifteen countries in Western and Eastern Europe, this film touches upon all aspects of conservation, including: treasures lost, restoration, new uses for old buildings, traffic, pressures of tourism, unsightly advertising, and the activities of local authorities and conservation authorities.

results.title: Eudyptula Minor (Fairy Penguins)
results.creator_credit: Graham Pizzey, Art Mayer and Comalco
results.brief_description: Inhabiting the milder waters of southern Australia and New Zealand, the Fairy Penguin does not grow to the height of its companions in the Antarctic regions; it stands about 16 inches tall. This film shot at Summerlands Beach, a protected nesting ground on Phillip Island, follows the penguins through their daily routine, beginning with their return from the sea at dusk after fishing.

results.title: Ethiopian mosaic
results.creator_credit: Desmond Dew, Hugh O'Connor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An engrossing blend of scenes in the ancient kingdom of Ethiopia where indolent camels still sway through the sand and long-robed tribesmen race their Arabian steeds, while great airliners glide into a modern airport. Produced without commentary, this film seems to put the viewer in the midst of the crowds of smiling people, among whom is glimpsed the emperor himself, Haile Selassie, Lion of Judah.

results.title: Ethiopia advances
results.brief_description: An account of the work of the Food and Agriculture Organisation of the United Nations in helping Ethiopia make best use of her fertile land. FAO experts’ recommendations included the use of labour saving farm implements; importation of new seeds to improve local crop; the setting up of an experimental seed growing station; the vaccination of Zebu cattle against Rinderpest.

results.title: The Eternal forest
results.creator_credit: United States. Forest Service and U.S.A Department of Agriculture
results.brief_description: The story of North America’s primeval forests showing early neglect in the years of America’s growth and expansion, as opposed to today’s sensible balance between the use of forest resources and their protection for future generations

results.title: The Eternal fight
results.creator_credit: Victor Vicas, Michael Alexander, Madeleine Carroll Films and United Nations. Film Board
results.brief_description: Through history humans have fought an eternal struggle against plagues, hunger, and war. Scientists of many nations have contributed to this fight against disease. The developments of the 19th and 20th centuries havce created new health problems because of industrial employment, crowded cities and more rapid means of communication. Control of disease is only now possible on a world-wide basis. The film is a dramatised story of the work of the World Health Organisation organsied to fight disease on a global scale.

results.title: Etcetera
results.brief_description: Black and white abstract drawings (by Jesse Reichek) are fused with ethnic African drum music to produce a visual and musical experience, arousing vivid emotional associations.

results.title: Estuaries
results.creator_credit: Dietmar Fill, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Micro-photographic study of marine life in estuaries. Shows a great variety of marine animals and plants that thrive in the unique environment of the estuaries, one of the most productive natural systems in the world. Details the lifestyles of the sea horse, semaphore crabs, soldier crabs, prawns, oysters and mangroves.

results.title: An Essay on war
results.creator_credit: Andrew A Rooney and Essay Productions
results.brief_description: Examines past and present reasons for waging war, the distance between those who declare war and those who fight it, the self-seeking of peacetime and the high productivity and united attitude of wartime, and the great ideals of war beside its horrible reality. Presents the positive and negative side of many moral questions related to war, and queries the need of civilised people to kill one another.
